column4: wtf? I'm trying to execute a file by typing $ ./a.out in the terminal (after cd'ing to the right directory) and it says "bash: ./a.out: No such file or directory"
I'm 100% sure the file is there!
it was already set by gcc
I sometimes have to add "sh" to the file, or at least make it executable.  Make sure its executable, use chmod or navigate to it in a GUI, right click and enable executing
